content.description:
Reactions 1 and 2 can be manipulated to produce reaction 3.

Reaction 1:  <math alttext="H 2 gas plus one half O 2 gas react to produce H 2 O liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H naught equals negative 285 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <mi>H</mi> <mi>°</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>285</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>kJ/mol</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

Reaction 2:  <math alttext="H 2 gas plus O 2 gas react to produce H 2 O 2 aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H naught equals question mark" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Reaction 3:  <math alttext="2 H 2 O 2 aqueous reacts to produce 2 H 2 O liquid plus O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H naught equals negative 200 decimal point kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>200.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: What is the value of <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <mi>H</mi> <mi>°</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> for reaction 2 ?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 370 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>370</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 185 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>185</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="85 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>85</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="185 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>185</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative 185 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>185</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
